title: Swordfish
description: Extend X-Wing pattern to 3x3 for even more powerful eliminations

steps.title: The 3x3 Pattern
steps.content:
Learn **Swordfish** - the 3x3 extension of X-Wing.

**What You'll Learn:**
- Swordfish pattern (3x3 grid)
- How it extends X-Wing logic
- Finding and applying swordfish

**Time Estimate:** 30 minutes

steps.title: Swordfish Pattern
steps.content:
**Swordfish Definition:**
When a digit appears in 2-3 positions in each of 3 rows (or columns), and those positions span only 3 columns (or rows).

**Example:**
Digit 7 in Row 2: columns 1, 5, 8
Digit 7 in Row 4: columns 1, 8
Digit 7 in Row 7: columns 5, 8

**Forms Swordfish:**
- 3 rows involved
- Positions span exactly 3 columns (1, 5, 8)
- Eliminate 7 from ALL other cells in columns 1, 5, and 8

**Requirements:**
- Exactly 3 rows/columns
- 2-3 positions per row/column
- Positions span exactly 3 crossing lines

**Rare but Powerful:**
Swordfish is rare but solves expert puzzles when found.

steps.title: Practice Swordfish
steps.content:
Find swordfish patterns in these expert puzzles.

**Goal:** Complete at least 2 of 3 puzzles

puzzles.title: Row Swordfish
hints: Find 3 rows where 4 spans same 3 columns

puzzles.title: Column Swordfish
hints: Find 3 columns where 6 spans same 3 rows

questions.question: How does Swordfish differ from X-Wing?
questions.explanation: Swordfish extends X-Wing from 2x2 to 3x3 - using 3 rows/columns instead of 2.

questions.question: In a row-based Swordfish, what do you eliminate?
questions.explanation: In row-based Swordfish, eliminate the digit from the 3 crossing columns (except the Swordfish cells).

questions.question: Why is Swordfish rare?
options: Requires very specific alignment of candidates
questions.explanation: Swordfish requires precise alignment: digit in 2-3 positions across exactly 3 rows/columns, spanning exactly 3 crossing lines. This specific pattern is uncommon.
